thread.title: Internet, meet Finland's adorable first dog, Lennu
thread.title_full: Internet, meet Finland's adorable first dog, Lennu

author: Joseph Earp
title: Internet, meet Finland's adorable first dog, Lennu
text:
The world has been suffering political dog content withdrawals. After all, everyone's still grieving the sudden withdrawal of the Obama family's dogs, Bo and Sunny, from the world stage. 
Donald Trump, of course, has no pets .
It makes sense then that the desperate gaze of pup-lovers worldwide has fallen on Finland and President Sauli Niinist√∂'s badass pup, Lennu.
SEE ALSO: Doggy tour bus shows adventurous pups the sights of London 
Lennu, a five-year-old Boston terrier, according to the Finnish outlet Yle Uutiset , has been making public appearances for some time now. He's not fully media trained, and has a habit of distracting the cameras away from his owner and onto his own antics . And now, people outside Finland have caught on.
excuse me but are you aware of Lennu, the Finnish president's dog pic.twitter.com/sBVSOiExw6 
‚Äî Kelly Weill (@KELLYWEILL) February 22, 2017 
Lennu made a splash on Twitter, and the internet began hunting for as many photos of the presidential pupper as could be found.
ever since seeing that tweet earlier I can't stop looking at pictures of Sauli Niinist√∂'s dog ffs pic.twitter.com/bdTCjYTlKJ 
‚Äî minna helena (@minna_helena) February 22, 2017 
The President of Finland and is dog is everything pic.twitter.com/c8nKtbUWuv 
‚Äî Dana (@droohani) February 22, 2017 
In other news, The Finnish President's dog Lennu is 1000x more presidential than our soulless circus peanut. üòç pic.twitter.com/7mh5Dw19yF 
‚Äî Shannon DeVido (@shannondevido) February 22, 2017 
Lennu has even been memed, as one would expect given the dog's endlessly jubilant expression.
@anttirita Hmmm... #Lennu pic.twitter.com/XMsiiVNYQL 
‚Äî Julkkiskokki (@anttirita) December 16, 2016 
what i look like when i try to smile at strangers... #lennu pic.twitter.com/AwELSZjkkw 
‚Äî j. carlisle larsen (@jcarlislelarsen) February 22, 2017 
Finland's president himself seems pretty cool ‚Äî he survived the deadly tsunami in Thailand in 2004 ‚Äî but he doesn't have quite the same goofy charisma as Lennu. Sorry Sauli!
BONUS: This smart collar will make pet care a walk in the park
